me.taylorkelly.mywarp.bukkit.util

Class FormattingUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.taylorkelly.mywarp.bukkit.util.FormattingUtils

  • public final class FormattingUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides several static methods that allow basic formatting of strings send to players. Colors are supported, bold and italic formatting not!

    The basic character widths this class relies on where extracted from old Minecraft source code. The algorithm and supported characters in Minecraft have changed, but these changes are not covered!

        public static int getWidth(char character)
        Gets the width of the given character. Will return 0 if the character is not displayed or not covered by the underling data.
        Parameters:
        character - the character to check
        Returns:
        the width of the character in pixels

        Parameters:

        trimmedWidth - the width of the trimmed string

        the trimmed string

      • wrap

        public static java.lang.String wrap(java.lang.String str,
                                    java.lang.String newLinePrefix,
                                    int wrappedWidth)
        Wraps the given String into multiple lines so that each line is at most as wide as the given width. Each new line will start with the given prefix.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to wrap
        newLinePrefix - the prefix for created new lines
        wrappedWidth - the width of each line
        Returns:
        the wrapped string

        Parameters:

        rightColumn - the contents of the right column

      • twoColumnAlign

        public static java.lang.String twoColumnAlign(java.lang.String leftColumn,
                                              java.lang.String rightColumn,
                                              char pad)
        Calls twoColumnAlign(String, String, char, int) using the chat width as totalWidth.
        Parameters:
        leftColumn - the contents of the left column
        rightColumn - the contents of the right column
        pad - the padding character
        Returns:
        the formatted string

      • twoColumnAlign

        public static java.lang.String twoColumnAlign(java.lang.String leftColumn,
                                              java.lang.String rightColumn,
                                              char pad,
                                              int totalWidth)
        Creates a two-column-layout from the given strings, using the given character as padding in between with the given total width. The left column will be aligned on the left, the right column on the right of the given width.
        Parameters:
        leftColumn - the contents of the left column
        rightColumn - the contents of the right column
        pad - the padding character
        totalWidth - the horizontal width that should be covered by the layout
        Returns:
        the formatted string

      • toList

        public static java.lang.String toList(java.util.List<java.lang.String> entries)
        Calls toList(char, List) using a '-' as list character.
        Parameters:
        entries - the list's entries
        Returns:
        a string with all entries

      • toList

        public static java.lang.String toList(char listChar,
                                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> entries)
        Calls toList(char, int, List) using the chat width as totalWidth.
        Parameters:
        listChar - the character that will be displayed as bullet point before each entry
        entries - the list's entries
        Returns:
        a string with all entries

      • toList

        public static java.lang.String toList(char listChar,
                                      int maxWidth,
                                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> entries)
        Creates a not numbered list from the given strings. Each string represents an independent entry on the list. Strings that are longer than the given width will be split above several lines.
        Parameters:
        listChar - the character that will be displayed as bullet point before each entry
        maxWidth - the maximal width of each entry
        entries - the list's entries
        Returns:
        the list
